body_html:
This looks similar to the cases with TensorFlow Serving build failures due to insufficient RAM. If it fails in the link stage there usually is no specific message. If the failure is I the compile stage sometimes the text “gcc: internal compiler error: Killed (program cc1plus)” will be found in the error log.

You are cross compiling and I do not know how much that will change things, but for i386 builds this has helped.

Try adding this to your build command: "bazel build -c opt --jobs 1 --local_resources 5000,1.0,1.0 --verbose_failures"

Because your failure is in the link phase the --jobs 1 may have the most effect. For TensorFlow Serving the least amount of free RAM anyone, giving feedback, has has success with is 4GB.

If the failure is I the compile stage sometimes the text “gcc: internal compiler error: Killed (program cc1plus)” will be found in the error log.  

You are cross compiling and I do not know how much that will change things, but for i386 builds this has helped.

Try adding this to your build command: "bazel build -c opt --jobs 1 --local_resources 5000,1.0,1.0 --verbose_failures"

Because your failure is in the link phase the --jobs 1 may have the most effect. For TensorFlow Serving the least amount of free RAM anyone, giving feedback, has has success with is 4GB.
